type.name: ordered_item_select
type.description: This selects between a particular version, view definition, or occurrence of a part.

type.name: work_order_organization_or_person_in_organization_item
type.description: This select extends the assignments of an organization or a person in an organization to Work_order instances.

type.name: work_order_date_or_date_time_item
type.description: This select is a extends the assignments of a date or a date and time to Work_order instances.

type.name: work_order_approval_item
type.description: This select extends an approval_assignment to apply to Work_order instances.

type.name: work_order_contract_item
type.description: This select extends an contract_assignment to apply to Work_order instances.

entity.name: Activity
entity.description: an Activity (also 'procedure', 'process' or 'action') is a specified operation usually doing some type of work to produce some identified output. Status information specifying the level of completion of each activity may be specified. The items that are affected by a specific Activity, e.g. as input or output, may also be identified. A description of the adopted solution procedure selected to carry out the action is also given.

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: specifies the word or common name used to refer to the Activity.

explicit.name: description
explicit.description: specifies additional information about the Activity.

explicit.name: status
explicit.description: a user interpretable designation for the level of completion or state of the Activity.

explicit.name: adopted_solution
explicit.description: specifies the particular solution selected for the Activity.

explicit.name: input_items
explicit.description: items which the Activity requires as input in order to carry out the adopted solution procedure.

explicit.name: output_items
explicit.description: items which are produced by the Activity as a result of the adopted solution procedure.

entity.name: Work_definition
entity.description:
A Work_definition represents the overall work procedure that is defined and controlled by a Work_order (in response to one or more Work_requests). A Work_definition is a type of
Activity

inverse.name: associated_order
inverse.description: the Work_order associated with and controlling the Work_definition.

entity.name: Work_order
entity.description:
A Work_order describes how an official request for work is addressed and incorporated through appropriate activities during the engineering release or change process. The Work_order may or may not ever actually be incorporated, depending upon the level of authorization granted to it.
Every Work_order consists of a work directive in response to a Work_request, and a directed activity that defines the work to be done. This
Work_definition
represents the main
Activity
that has to be carried out as part of the Work_order.

explicit.name: name
explicit.description: the identification used to refer to the Work_order, unique in conjunction with the in_response_to Work_requests.

explicit.name: description
explicit.description: specifies additional information about the Work_order.

explicit.name: in_response_to
explicit.description: specifies the Work_request(s) that are addressed by the Work_order.

explicit.name: directed_activity
explicit.description: the Work_definition associated with the Work_order.

derived.name: adopted_solution
derived.description: description of the solution procedure selected by the Work_order.

derived.name: output_items
derived.description: items which are produced by the Work_order as a result of the adopted solution procedure.

derived.name: status
derived.description: a user interpretable designation for the level of completion of the Work_order.

inverse.name: requestor
inverse.description: specifies the organization or person that initiated the Work_order.

inverse.name: order_date
inverse.description: specifies the date or date_time when the Work_order was initiated.

inverse.name: approval
inverse.description: specifies the level of auhorization of the Work_order.

inverse.name: contracts
inverse.description: specifies the contracts sponsoring the Work_order.
